example: She was on cloud nine after getting the promotion.
He's been down in the dumps since his dog passed away.
Even during the emergency, she remained cool as a cucumber.
Don't bite my head off, I was just asking a question!
She was over the moon when she found out she was pregnant.
I've been feeling blue since my friend moved away.
I was on pins and needles waiting for the test results.

idiom: Like a bear with a sore head
example: Don't talk to him this morning - he's like a bear with a sore head.
After their first kiss, he was walking on air for days.

idiom: At the end of one's rope
meaning: На пределе, больше нет сил терпеть
example: After the third night without sleep, I'm at the end of my rope.
She was bursting with joy when she saw her surprise birthday party.
He's been down in the mouth ever since he lost his job.
When he saw the mess, he was fit to be tied.
He got cold feet and canceled the wedding the day before.

idiom: Get off on the wrong foot
example: We got off on the wrong foot, but now we're good friends.
That old house gives me the creeps.
My grandmother has a heart of gold - she helps everyone.
I always have butterflies in my stomach before a big presentation.
My dad hit the roof when he saw the car damage.
Even though he was scared, he kept a stiff upper lip.
When they asked her the question, she was like a deer in headlights.
I'm sorry I lost my temper earlier.
I've been on edge all day waiting for the phone call.
After winning the championship, the team was on top of the world.
I'm feeling out of sorts today - maybe I'm getting sick.
Pull yourself together - you can do this!
When I heard the noise, I was shaking like a leaf.
When she saw her grades, she was smiling from ear to ear.
I was sweating bullets during the entire job interview.
I've been tearing my hair out trying to fix this computer problem.
She was tickled pink with her birthday present.
Ever since their argument, I've been walking on eggshells around them.

idiom: Wearing your heart on your sleeve
example: She always wears her heart on her sleeve, so you know exactly how she feels.
With a heavy heart, I must announce my resignation.
He's had a chip on his shoulder ever since he was passed over for promotion.
Tell me what happened - I'm all ears.
She was beside herself with worry when her son didn't come home.
He's in one of his black moods today - better leave him alone.
When he saw the mess, he blew his top.
Cheer up! Things will get better.
It was a cold-blooded murder.
She cried her eyes out at the end of the movie.
I'm feeling under the weather, so I'm going to stay home.
He flies off the handle at the smallest things.
I got carried away and spent too much money.
His constant humming is getting on my nerves.
She went to pieces when she heard the bad news.
When she saw her friend's new car, she was green with envy.
I have a soft spot for stray animals.
He's too hot-headed to be a good manager.
The team was in high spirits after their victory.
The children were jumping for joy when school was canceled.
It's Friday night - time to let your hair down!

meaning: Расслабиться, не принимать близко к сердцу
example: Lighten up! It's just a game.
I'm sorry I lost my cool during the meeting.
